title: How many numbers of number keys are in a keyboard? - Quora

response.answer_text: Zero to nine - so ten numbers. Of course, there can be multiple key sets. Accountants like a keyboard with a “numeric keypad”, and the IBM PC keyboard had that, so two sets of “number keys”. Some laptops have a “function key” that converts part of the keyboard to such a numeric keypad (eg. Dell). Some keyboards have no “number keys” at all, and others (eg. Baudot coding) have a “numeric shift”. Or just letters or other symbols. A morse code sender has no letters or numbers — just a switch. A four or five finger chorded keyboard also has no explicit letters or numbers. That means: 0, 1, 1 1/2, 2.

I suggest people stop answering these stupid questions. People can very easily count the keys themselves. As for the people asking the questions, stop being either lazy or trying to make others look foolish for answering your asicine questions.
